docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Lester Minto knows he won't be able to reopen his clinic after a federal appeals court upheld tough new abortion restrictions in Texas. But he insists he won't be silenced.

headline.main: Court Hands Setback to Texas Abortion Law Critics
headline.print_headline: Court Hands Setback to Texas Abortion Law Critics

docs.snippet: Dr. Lester Minto knows he won't be able to reopen his clinic after a federal appeals court upheld tough new abortion restrictions in Texas. But he insists he won't be silenced.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court on Thursday upheld Texas' tough abortion restrictions that have forced the closure of about 20 clinics around the state, saying the new rules don't jeopardize women's health.

headline.main: US Appeals Court Upholds New Texas Abortion Rules
headline.print_headline: US Appeals Court Upholds New Texas Abortion Rules

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court on Thursday upheld Texas' tough abortion restrictions that have forced the closure of about 20 clinics around the state, saying the new rules don't jeopardize women's health.

docs.lead_paragraph: Women's rights advocates sought international help Thursday in ending what they call a pattern of poor indigenous Mexican women being turned away from hospitals while in labor, forcing them to give birth on lawns, patios or parking lots.

headline.main: Activists: Mexican Women Giving Birth in Street
headline.print_headline: Activists: Mexican Women Giving Birth in Street

docs.snippet: Women's rights advocates sought international help Thursday in ending what they call a pattern of poor indigenous Mexican women being turned away from hospitals while in labor, forcing them to give birth on lawns, patios or parking lots.

docs.lead_paragraph: A law set to go into effect next Tuesday would impose the strictest rules in the country over the use of medication to induce abortions during the early stages of pregnancy.

headline.main: Court Weighs Delay of Strict Limits to Drug-Induced Abortions in Arizona
headline.print_headline: Court Weighs Delay of Strict Limits to Drug-Induced Abortions in Arizona

docs.abstract: Federal Judge David C Bury weighs arguments over Arizona law set to go in effect that would impose the strictest rules in the country over the use of medication to induce abortions during the early stages of pregnancy.
docs.snippet: A law set to go into effect next Tuesday would impose the strictest rules in the country over the use of medication to induce abortions during the early stages of pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: A small study that examined brains from children who died found abnormal patterns of cell growth in autistic children. The research bolsters evidence that something before birth might cause autism, at least in some cases.

headline.main: Autism May Be Tied to Flawed Prenatal Brain Growth
headline.print_headline: Autism May Be Tied to Flawed Prenatal Brain Growth

docs.snippet: A small study that examined brains from children who died found abnormal patterns of cell growth in autistic children. The research bolsters evidence that something before birth might cause autism, at least in some cases.

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts gave dueling opinions Wednesday on what likely killed a pregnant Army soldier whose husband is charged with murder, leaving a military judge to sort out whether she was strangled to death, suffered a sudden heart attack or died from causes that can't be determined.

headline.main: Experts Duel Over What Killed Ga. Soldier's Wife
headline.print_headline: Experts Duel Over What Killed Ga. Soldier's Wife

docs.snippet: Experts gave dueling opinions Wednesday on what likely killed a pregnant Army soldier whose husband is charged with murder, leaving a military judge to sort out whether she was strangled to death, suffered a sudden heart attack or died from causes...

docs.lead_paragraph: A bill introduced in Pakistan's National Assembly to increase the punishment for guardians, clerics and spouses involved in child marriages should be supported by religious leaders, the legislator behind the move said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Pakistan Lawmaker Battles to Raise Punishment for Child Marriage
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Lawmaker Battles to Raise Punishment for Child Marriage

docs.snippet: A bill introduced in Pakistan's National Assembly to increase the punishment for guardians, clerics and spouses involved in child marriages should be supported by religious leaders, the legislator behind the move said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Social scientists, economists and other scholars have had a difficult time explaining the significance of the growing income gap.

headline.main: Income Equality: A Search for Consequences
headline.print_headline: A Search for Answers on Income Inequality

docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column notes that many social scientists, economists and other scholars have had a difficult time explaining significance of the growing income gap; asserts that while many claims about its effects upon society may be widely exaggerated or cannot be backed up, income inequality should still be source of concern.
docs.snippet: Social scientists, economists and other scholars have had a difficult time explaining the significance of the growing income gap.

docs.lead_paragraph: A woman who, as a newborn, was abandoned in the bathroom of a Pennsylvania fast-food restaurant said Tuesday she has found her birth mother just three weeks after launching a search that garnered worldwide attention.

headline.main: Burger King Baby Finds Birth Mom, Feels 'Pure Joy'
headline.print_headline: Burger King Baby Finds Birth Mom, Feels 'Pure Joy'

docs.snippet: A woman who, as a newborn, was abandoned in the bathroom of a Pennsylvania fast-food restaurant said Tuesday she has found her birth mother just three weeks after launching a search that garnered worldwide attention.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court on Tuesday ruled that Kansas can strip two Planned Parenthood clinics of federal family planning money while the organization moves forward with its legal challenge of a state law it says is retaliation for its advocacy of abortion rights.

headline.main: Ruling: Kansas Can Strip Planned Parenthood Funds
headline.print_headline: Ruling: Kansas Can Strip Planned Parenthood Funds
